tools.name: benchmarks
tools.description:
This tool provides benchmarks for various common reporting metrics.
        The benchmarks data are derived from the data of select CustomerGauge B2B Accounts for the current period.
        Only existing accounts that sent more than 100 survey invitations in the period are included in the benchmark.
        Benchmarks data has a fixed date range of the last two semesters. The benchmarks data is updated every 6 months.

        Avaliable filters:
            - metric: The metric to receive benchmark data for.
            - industry: The industry of the Accounts to receive benchmark data for, for the selected metric.

        Parameters:
            - metric: Choose the metric to receive benchmark data for. Allowed values: Account Response %, Detractor Follow Up %, Detractor Follow Up Speed, Email Bounce %, Email Delivery %, Email Open %, NPS, Response %, Survey Abandonment %, Survey Click %.
            - industry: Allowed values: B2B, Consumer Goods, Manufacturing, Software / IT.

metric.description: Choose the metric to receive benchmark data for.

industry.description: The industry of the Accounts to receive benchmark data for, for the selected metric.

tools.name: drivers_loyalty
tools.description:
This tool returns your Drivers and how many selections each Driver received per NPS loyalty group (promoters, passives, detractors).
        Promoters select the Drivers that they are happy with or would recommend.
        Passives and Detractors select the Drivers they feel could use improvement or are not happy with.
        Drivers are a two-tiered checkbox question on the survey which contain a list of primary Drivers, with each Driver containing a sub-list of secondary Drivers.

        Avaliable filters:
            - period_start: The start date of the period.
            - period_end: The end date of the period.
            - period_field: The field to filter by.
            - criterias: Filters to apply when we want results limited to a specific criteria
            - driver_level: Choose between retrieving the data for primary or secondary drivers.

        You can use the tool 'fields' to get a list of possible fields to filter in criterias.
        You can use the tool 'field_values' to get a list of possible values for a field_values in criterias.

tools.name: support
tools.description:
A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) powered MCP tool that enables users to search and interact 
      with CustomerGauge’s Best Practices and Knowledge Base content. 
      This agent uses semantic search and context-aware retrieval to find relevant information from support articles,
      guides, and internal expertise, providing accurate, conversational answers enriched with source references.
      
      Key Features:
        Best Practices Access: Quickly retrieve step-by-step guidance and proven strategies 
          for running an Account Experience / Customer Experience Program effectively.
        Knowledge Base Search: Understands and navigates CustomerGauge’s support articles, FAQs, and technical documentation.
        Context-Aware Answers: Combines retrieved knowledge with LLM reasoning to provide clear, tailored responses.
        Source Linking: Returns relevant article links and excerpts for transparency and follow-up.
        Multi-Language Support: Capable of finding and summarizing information in multiple languages when available.

      Intended Use Cases:
        Helping CustomerGauge users troubleshoot issues.
        Assisting Customer Experience teams with best practice recommendations.
        Providing onboarding guidance for new users.
        Acting as a quick-reference tool for support and implementation teams.

tools.name: topics_by_sentiment
tools.description:
This tool provides a comprehensive analysis of Topics by Sentiment from survey responses.
        It identifies topics mentioned in open-text comments and categorizes them by sentiment (positive, negative, neutral, mixed).
        This helps understand what aspects of your service or product are being praised or criticized.

        Each topic shows:
            - Total number of responses mentioning the topic
            - Breakdown by sentiment (positive, negative, neutral, mixed)
            - Sentiment distribution percentages
